title: Visual Exploration of DNA Replication: Enhanced Understanding Through Multiple Representations

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level life science foundational knowledge
context.additional_context: Optimized 2D/3D graphic utilization for smartphone-based learning, with real-time interaction for concept verification.

learning_goals: Learners can comparatively explain the four stages of DNA replication using textual/2D/3D representation methods.
Learners can analyze visual elements (color, shape, complexity) to identify key features of the DNA replication process.
Learners can effectively interpret scientific visualization materials using digital tools (smartphones) in constrained environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
